channel.title: LightRune - a lightweight nio framework
channel.description:
[IMG]http://i.imgur.com/8Qqqf.png[/img]
This is a framework I've wrote few months back. It supposed to be a lightweight, lib-free server base for me to write content on. After few weeks of programming I've understood that I'm capable of writing a better things, so I decided to quit this once and for all. It's highly documented and very simplistic, hopefully community will find it useful.
[size=18pt]Features[/size]
[ul][li]Rendering.[/li] [li]Multi-player.[/li] [li]Walking.[/li] [li]Chatting.[/li] [li]Inventory support.[/li] [li]Equipping.[/li] [li]Banking.[/li] [li]Ground items.[/li] [li]Trading, not complete.[/li] [li]Start of private messaging.[/li][/ul]
[size=18pt]Media[/size]
[CENTER][IMG]http://i.imgur.com/S88ky.png[/img]
[IMG]http://i.imgur.com/8Olgy.png[/img]
[IMG]http://i.imgur.com/YacTg.png[/img][/CENTER]
[size=18pt]Download[/size]
UppIT Download: http://uppit.com/f8fgkx1sryar/LightRune.rar Mediafire Download: http://www.mediafire.com/?hlnnyir9v02dszf
[size=18pt]Credits[/size]
[ul][li]kLeptO - I've wrote everything myself.[/li] [li]Darkie - Explained to me how RuneScape gameplay works.[/li] [li]WH:II:DOW - Helped me with some protocol related questions.[/li] [li]Knugen - Kept me motivated towards writing it.[/li][/ul]

item.title: LightRune - a lightweight nio framework
item.dc:creator: @kLeptO kLeptO
item.description:
@kLeptO wrote:

Re-uploaded a new version.
Accidentally removed one line of code before releasing making ground items stay forever.
By the way, it’s now designed to work with jre6 as many complained, headicons are enabled too.

Read full topic

item.title: LightRune - a lightweight nio framework
item.dc:creator: @DannyIsSoPro DannyIsSoPro
item.description:
@DannyIsSoPro wrote:

[quote=“kLeptO, post:7, topic:447549”]That’s probably because your client has head icons enabled. Simple fix for it would be to replace this in PlayerUpdating.java:

With this:

props.putByte(-1); // TODO: Player Skull props.putByte(-1); // TODO: Player Headicon[/quote]

Ah thank you. Forgot about this.

Read full topic

item.title: LightRune - a lightweight nio framework
item.dc:creator: @kLeptO kLeptO
item.description:
@kLeptO wrote:

That’s probably because your client has head icons enabled. Simple fix for it would be to replace this in PlayerUpdating.java:

With this:

props.putByte(-1); // TODO: Player Skull props.putByte(-1); // TODO: Player Headicon

item.title: LightRune - a lightweight nio framework
item.dc:creator: @kLeptO kLeptO
item.description:
@kLeptO wrote:

[quote=“DannyIsSoPro, post:2, topic:447549”]Lolwut, wait so, you have two accounts? You’re Skyro in the pictures, and their is a Skyro registered on these forums. But the account you just posted this on is kLeptO, and you’re a moderator on Rune-serba, and … what?

Can someone clarify this for me?

Nice release if that is really you…
Definitely will use this.[/quote]

I used to be known as sKyrO until some 13 year old kid hijacked my username on here, then I switched it back to kLeptO.
Skyro from Moparscape is not me. The time I developed this my username on Rune-Server was still sKyrO.
If you need clarification just PM me on Rune-Server.

Read full topic

item.title: LightRune - a lightweight nio framework

Can someone clarify this for me?

Nice release if that is really you…
Definitely will use this.

This is a framework I’ve wrote few months back. It supposed to be a lightweight, lib-free server base for me to write content on.
After few weeks of programming I’ve understood that I’m capable of writing a better things, so I decided to quit this once and for all.
It’s highly documented and very simplistic, hopefully community will find it useful.
